programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: IM Academy sold a dream of financial freedom; but behind the luxury lifestyles and Instagram hype, thousands found themselves inside a multi-level marketing maze that left many broke and broken.

programme.title: The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations
programme.sub-title: Mohamed Kalifa Al Mubarak, Abu Dhabi Department of Culture & Tourism Chairman

programme.title: Bloomberg Originals
programme.desc: Experts offer bold takes on some of today's most important topics and cover stories and investigations at the intersection of business and culture.

programme.title: Bloomberg Wall Street Week
programme.desc: A weekly program telling the stories of capitalism from around the world, David Westin in New York hosts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Next Africa
programme.desc: A monthly deep dive into Africa's biggest stories through a Bloomberg lens. Global investors see the continent as one of the top areas for opportunity and growth, and some African nations are well-positioned to be global hubs for development. This show will discuss key steps taken to help deliver on Africa's quest of bridging the gap with global powers, and track capital flows and the direction of funds amid the underlying political, economic and social developments.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.sub-title: The College Sports Buzz With Georgia Tech's J Batt
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit with Georgia Tech Athletics Director J Batt during March Madness to discuss the buzz around college athletics, including NIL and the transfer portal.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.sub-title: Investing in Women's Sports With Mellody Hobson
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit down with Mellody Hobson, co-CEO and president of Ariel Investments, to discuss her firm's fund, Project Level, devoted to investing in women's sports.

programme.title: Bullish: Why Wall Street Is Going South
programme.sub-title: Bullish: Why Wall Street Is Going South
programme.desc: There's been a migration of financial powerbrokers to South Florida in recent years, drawn by the weather, light regulation and low taxes. It's hard to imagine the capital of finance leaving NY, but Wall Street South is getting bigger every day.

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.sub-title: The Gambler's Edge on Wall Street
programme.desc: Wall Street pros often play poker, chess, blackjack and other games that rely on skills that are highly transferable to their work; the lines between finance and gaming are blurring faster than ever.

programme.desc: Building wealth used to follow a formula, but these days it's easier than ever to play the markets. With investing tools at everyone's fingertips, is it a chance for generational wealth or a siren call for suckers?
